channel.title: /var/log/kern.log contains 4 denied messages in the last day
channel.description:
- Non-Qubes Whonix. - Whonix Gateway and Whonix Workstation v. 13. - No App Armour rules set.
For about 6 or 7 days, every time I start Gateway and Workstation, both machines give the notification:
"/var/log/kern.log contains 4 denied messages in the last day"
in kern.log, the denied messages read:
[quote] host kernel: [ xxx ] audit: type=1400 audit(14703xxxxxx): apparmor="DENIED" operation="open" profile="/usr/bin/whonixcheck" name="/etc/perl/sitecustomize.pl" pid=4546 comm="vrms" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=1000 ouid=0 [/quote]
it seems to be a problem with whonixcheck and perl? is it possible that it relates to DSA-3628-1 perl -- security update (https://www.debian.org/security/2016/dsa-3628)?
thanks for any advice

item.title: /var/log/kern.log contains 4 denied messages in the last day
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Will be fixed in Whonix 14.

You can ignore this or test / emulate the below commit.

github.com/Whonix/whonixcheck

fix apparmor /etc/perl/sitecustomize.pl warning 

Thanks to massy1 for reporting this bug?
http://forums.whonix.org/t/var-log-kern-log-contains-4-denied-messages-in-the-last-day
by adrelanos on 07:36PM - 10 Aug 16
changed 1 files with 1 additions and 0 deletions.

Read full topic
item.source: /var/log/kern.log contains 4 denied messages in the last day

item.title: /var/log/kern.log contains 4 denied messages in the last day
item.dc:creator: massy1
item.description:
• Non-Qubes Whonix.
  • Whonix Gateway and Whonix Workstation v. 13.
  • No App Armour rules set.

For about 6 or 7 days, every time I start Gateway and Workstation, both machines give the notification:

“/var/log/kern.log contains 4 denied messages in the last day”

in kern.log, the denied messages read:

host kernel: [ xxx ] audit: type=1400 audit(14703xxxxxx): apparmor=“DENIED” operation=“open” profile="/usr/bin/whonixcheck" name="/etc/perl/sitecustomize.pl" pid=4546 comm=“vrms” requested_mask=“r” denied_mask=“r” fsuid=1000 ouid=0

it seems to be a problem with whonixcheck and perl? is it possible that it relates to DSA-3628-1 perl – security update (https://www.debian.org/security/2016/dsa-3628)?

thanks for any advice
